result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Steven Richard Mcdaniel.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. NGI evaluation will take place with the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Collins on 9/13/2022 at 11:30AM. Case remains calendared in Branch 04.

Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defense letter to court, filed.

22RM033207  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
07/02/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for level 4 SUPERVISION.  Court ordered previous no contact/no firearms conditions remain.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet upon release once available, absolute sobriety, and defendant to NOT be present in any residential building where firearms are located.

Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
letter from parents regarding bail

Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in court by video with Attorney Michael M. Hayes who appears in person.  Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in custody.  Daniel Flaherty appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Whitefish Bay Detective J. McLeod. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to the Court.
Bail Motion.

Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel not in court, defendant in custody. Attorney Michael M Hayes appears in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant in custody currently in the hospital. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 048045,

Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Eric M.B.; Jonathan A.K.; Rafal A.K.; Sabrina L.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Steven Richard Mcdaniel in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven Richard Mcdaniel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Court ordered Deputy Zachary Paulson to take a DNA sample from defendant while at hospital.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
